result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Neglecting a Child (Specified Harm Did Not Occur)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Catherine F Colson

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Catherine F Colson in court with attorney Connor Romenesko.  Jessica Ann Behling appeared on behalf of Mallory Davis for the State of Wisconsin.

Case in court for Deferred Prosecution Agreement Hearing. Matter held via Zoom video conference and streamed through DAcast. 

Parties are prepared to enter into a deferred prosecution agreement.

As to Counts 1 and 2: Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Complaint/Information.  Court WITHHELD entry of judgment of conviction.  Deferred Prosecution Agreement received, signed and filed.
 
Court ordered case adjourned for Review in Branch 10.  Review hearing scheduled for December 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Early Intervention Program Child Protective Advocacy Deferred Prosecution Agreement, filed.
Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights, filed.

Defendant Catherine F Colson in court with attorney Connor Romenesko.  Claire E Zyber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
Parties are requesting a Deferred Prosecution Agreement hearing date. Case is adjourned to 8-15-22 at 2:00 pm for a DPA hearing. 
  This hearing may be streamed live on DAcast at the discretion of the Court:
https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/d84cd54a-763c-3a58-15a9-b84acf306616  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Catherine F Colson in court with attorney Connor Romenesko.  Ryan Jay Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Romenesko was just appointed to the case and needs discovery and an offer.  Case is adjourned to 7-21-22 at 8:30 am for status conference, to be held by zoom.
  This hearing may be streamed live on DAcast at the discretion of the Court:
https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/d84cd54a-763c-3a58-15a9-b84acf306616  Status conference scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.

DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON (5/19/2022). IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Defendant Catherine F Colson in court with attorney Sylvan Jaspen.  Claire Louise Starling appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Havas, Branch 10.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney. Defendant plead not guilty.  
Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 10.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 05/17/2022@1:30PM
